Welcome to Contacts project’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database connection is working. It does this by executing a simple SQL query and checking if it returns any results. If there are no results, then the database connection has failed.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Inject the database session into the function

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

main.index()¶
The index function is a simple function that returns the string &quot;Contact book&quot;

as a JSON object. This is to show that the API works and can return data.

Returns:

A dictionary with a key &quot;message&quot; and value &quot;contact book&quot;

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up.

Returns:

A fastapilimiter object

REST API repository Cont¶

async src.repository.contacts.contacts_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The contacts_upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next week. The function takes in an AsyncSession object and a User object as parameters, and returns a list of Contact objects.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: The current user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate a new contact`s data sent in the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: The current user

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: The contact id to delete

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: The current user

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_all_contacts function returns a list of all contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the first row to return

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A list of contact objects

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: The contact id what will be returned

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: The current user

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the given user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the query

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in a database session to the function

  • user – User: The current user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

async src.repository.contacts.search_contact(contact_query: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The search_contact function searches for contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_query – str: The query to search for a contact.

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: The current user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: The contact id to update

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate new data sent in the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: The current user

Returns:

A contact object

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function marks a user as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

It takes an email, username, and password as input. The function then hashes the password using bcrypt and stores it in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the input data

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_user_by_email function returns a user object from the database based on the email address provided.

Parameters:

  • email – str: The email address of the user to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object or none if no user is found

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: The email address of the user to update

  • url – str | None: The URL to set as the new avatar for this user, or None if no change is desired

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • token – str | None: Check if the token is a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

The function takes in a ContactSchema object, which is validated by pydantic. If the validation fails, an error will be thrown and caught by FastAPI’s exception handler. If it passes validation, then we create a new contact using our repository layer.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body against the contactschema schema

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contactschema object

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: The id of the contact to delete

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_all_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned by the function

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the maximum number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Set the offset of the query

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of the limit parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact function returns a contact by id.

If the user is not logged in, an HTTP 401 Unauthorized error will be returned. If the contact does not exist, an HTTP 404 Not Found error will be returned.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Specify the minimum value that limit can have

  • le – Limit the maximum number of contacts that can be returned

  • offset – int: Skip a certain number of contacts

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(contact_query: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The search_contacts function searches contacts by contact_query in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_query – str: The search query to use when searching for contacts

  • min_length – Ensure that the contact_query string is at least 3 characters long

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session from the dependency injection

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.search_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The search_upcoming_birthdays function searches for contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactSchema, contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: A ContactSchema object containing the new values for the contact

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be injected into the

get_current_user endpoint. It uses the auth_service to retrieve the current user, and returns it if found.

Parameters:

user – User: Get the user object

Returns:

The user object

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.
Args:

file (UploadFile): The image to be uploaded. current_user (User): The user whose avatar is being updated. db (AsyncSession): An async session for database access.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: The image to be uploaded

  • current_user – User: The user whose avatar is being updated

  • db – AsyncSession: Connect to the database

Returns:

The user object

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function was used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we raise an HTTPException with a status code of 400 (Bad Request). If they do exist in our database but their confirmed field is already True, then we return a JSON response with message Your email is already confirmed. Otherwise, we call function confirmed_email from repository and change mark to True.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

The message Your email is already confirmed or Email confirmed

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function was used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function was used to refresh the access token. It takes a refresh token as an argument and returns a new access_token, refresh_token pair. The old tokens are invalidated.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A new access_token, refresh_token pair

async src.routes.auth.request_email(username: str, response: Response, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function was used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to verify their account. The function takes in a username and returns an image of a checkmark if the email was opened successfully.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username of the user who is requesting an email

  • response – Response: Return the response to the client

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

A fileresponse object

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A userschema object

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '1234567890'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded access token for the user

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded in the token

Returns:

A jwt token

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: A dictionary containing the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the time for which the refresh token is valid

Returns:

A refresh token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function takes a refresh token and decodes it.

If the scope is ‘refresh_token’, then we return the email address of the user. Otherwise, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED).

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user, which is then used to get the user from the database

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be called by FastAPI to retrieve the current user. It uses the token in the Authorization header of each request to validate and decode it, then returns an object with the information about this user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection and pass it to the repository layer

Returns:

A user object

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user who is trying to verify their account

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password.

The function uses the pwd_context object to generate a hash from the given password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶
The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password,

and returns True if they match, False otherwise. This is used to verify that the user’s login credentials are correct.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password in the database with the plain text password entered by user

Returns:

True if the password is correct and false otherwise

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their email address.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for them

  • username – str: the username of the user, which is displayed in the body of the message

  • host – str: this is used as part of constructing a URL that will be sent to users so they can verify their account

Returns:

A coroutine object
